questions.question_text:
A project manager is assigned midway through a project. The team members are in different locations across the country and they are unable to meet in-person often. During a status review meeting, one of the stakeholders highlighted that they were unaware of the status for the project deliverables.

What should the project manager do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Fast-track the project
Fast-tracking allows the project manager to recover lost time by rearranging the project schedule without necessarily compromising on deliverables, as long as the project team can handle the increased risks associated with overlapping tasks.

Selected Answer: B
B. Fast-track the project

Selected Answer: B
Fast-tracking involves reordering or overlapping project activities that would normally be done in sequence. This approach can help in speeding up the project schedule without necessarily increasing the project cost significantly.
